summary: The Employee Benefits Security Administration is charged with protecting the benefits of about 154 million participants in employer-sponsored retirement and health benefit plans. The agency investigates benefit plan violations, such as financial misconduct in retirement plans and wrongly denied medical claims. title: Employee Benefits Security Administration: Enforcement Efforts to Protect Participants' Rights in Employer-Sponsored Retirement and Health Benefit Plans
